item.title: Jenni add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Louis Sachar
item.description: "Warning: Do not read this story right after eating. In fact, don't read it right before eating either. In fact, just to be safe, don't read this story if you're ever planning to eat again." -- Louis Sachar

item.title: Jenni add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Jenni add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "Let us tenderly and kindly cherish therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write ." -- John Adams

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "I've noticed that everyone who is for abortion has already been born." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "When I was young, my ambition was to be one of the people who made a difference in this world. My hope is to leave the world a little better for having been there. " -- Jim Henson

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "We are not trying to entertain the critics. I'll take my chances with the public." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "If all printers were determined not to print anything till they were sure it would offend nobody, there would be very little printed." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Jenni add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A library is like an island in the middle of a vast sea of ignorance, particularly if the library is very tall and the surrounding area has been flooded." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Jenni add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Do you not know I am a woman? when I think, I must speak." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "Anything one man can imagine, other men can make real." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "As a general rule,'he had once said, 'people ask for advice only in order not to follow it; or, if they do follow it, in order to have someone to blame for giving it.' (Athos)" -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "The difference between treason and patriotism is only a matter of dates." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jenni add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "But lest some unlucky event should happen unfavorable to my reputation, I beg it may be remembered by every gentleman in the room that I this day declare with the utmost sincerity, I do not think myself equal to the command I am honored with." -- George Washington

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jenni add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to be alone than in bad company." -- George Washington

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Peter Stone
item.description: "In my many years I have come to a conclusion that one useless man is a shame, two is a law firm, and three or more is a congress." -- Peter Stone

item.title: Jenni add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "Facts are stubborn things; and whatever may be our wishes, our inclinations, or the dictates of our passion, they cannot alter the state of facts and evidence." -- John Adams

item.title: Jenni add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Jenni add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "I read my eyes out and can't read half enough...the more one reads the more one sees we have to read." -- John Adams
